title: BPMN 2.0
description: This is the BPMN 2.0 stencil set specification.
description_de: Dies ist die BPMN 2.0 Stencilset Spezifikation.

properties.title: Id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the element.

properties.title: Caption
properties.description: The descriptive name of the BPMN element.

properties.title: Documentation
properties.description: This attribute is used to annotate the BPMN element, such as descriptions and other documentation.
properties.description_de: Der Modellierer kann weiteren Text zur Dokumentation des BPMN-Elementes einfügen.

properties.title: BackgroundColor
properties.description: Change the background color for a visual differentiation.
properties.description_de: Verändern Sie die Hintergrundfarbe für eine visuelle Unterscheidung.

properties.title: Border color
properties.description: Change the border color for a visual differentiation.
properties.description_de: Ändern Sie die Rahmenfarbe für eine visuelle Unterscheidung.

properties.title: ProcessID
properties.description: Defines the ID of the container process used in the exported BPMN 2.0 XML. The ID has to be a valid XSD:id string and identifies a process unambiguous.
properties.description_de: Definiert die ID des Prozesselementes im exportierten BPMN 2.0 XML. Die ID muss XSD:id konform sein und den Prozess eindeutig identifizieren.

properties.title: Cancel activity
properties.description: Denotes whether the activity should be canceled or not (i.e., whether the boundary catch event acts as an Error or an Escalation). If the activity is not canceled, multiple instances of that handler can run concurrently.
properties.description_de: Kennzeichnet, ob eine Aktivität abgebrochen werden soll oder nicht (d.h., ob ein angeheftetes eintretendes Ereignis als Fehler oder Eskalation auftreten kann). Wenn die Aktivität nicht beendet wird, können mehrere Instanzen der Behandlungsroutine parallel ausgeführt werden.

properties.title: Timedate
properties.description: The date of the timer definition.

properties.title: Timecycle
properties.description: The time cycle of the timer definition.

properties.title: Time duration
properties.description: The duration of the timer definition.

properties.title: Wait for completion
properties.description: Determine whether a throw compensation is performed synchronously or asynchronously.
properties.description_de: Gibt an, ob die erzeugte Kompensierung synchron oder asynchron aufgerufen wird.

properties.title: Activity reference
properties.description: The activity related to the compensation event

properties.title: Version
properties.description: This defines the version number of the diagram.

properties.title: Author
properties.description: This holds the name of the diagram's author.

properties.title: Language
properties.description: This holds the language in which text is written.
properties.description_de: Sprache, in welcher der Text verfasst ist.

properties.title: Target namespace
properties.description: Defines the XML namespace of the elements inside the document.
properties.description_de: Definiert den XML-Namensraum, der für die Elemente im Dokument verwendet wird.

properties.title: Creation date
properties.description: This defines the date on which the diagram was created.
properties.description_de: Datum, an dem das Diagramm erstellt wurde.

properties.title: Modification date
properties.description: This defines the date on which the diagram was last modified.

properties.title: Asynchronous
properties.description: Define the activity as asynchronous.

properties.title: Exclusive
properties.description: Define the activity as exclusive.

properties.title: Loop type
properties.description: Repeated activity execution (parallel or sequential) can be displayed through different loop types
properties.description_de: Wiederholtes (paralleles oder sequentielles) Ausführen einer Aktivität kann durch die Angabe eines Schleifentyps dargestellt werden.

properties.title: InputCollection (=)
properties.description: Define the input collection for the multi instance.

properties.title: InputElement
properties.description: Define the input element for the multi instance.

properties.title: OutputCollection
properties.description: Define the output collection for the multi instance.

properties.title: OutputElemente (=)
properties.description: Define the output element for the multi instance.

properties.description: Job type

properties.title: Retries
properties.description: Retries

properties.title: Is for compensation
properties.description: A flag that identifies whether this activity is intended for the purposes of compensation.

properties.description: Class that implements the service task logic.

properties.title: Result variable name
properties.description: Process variable name to store the service task result.

properties.title: Time End Date in ISO-8601
properties.description: Define the timer with a ISO-8601 end date.

properties.title: Time duration (e.g. PT5M)
properties.description:
Define the timer with a ISO-8601 duration.
  • P is the duration designator (for period) placed at the start of the duration representation.
  • Y is the year designator that follows the value for the number of years.
  • M is the month designator that follows the value for the number of months.
  • W is the week designator that follows the value for the number of weeks.
  • D is the day designator that follows the value for the number of days.
  • T is the time designator that precedes the time components of the representation.
  • H is the hour designator that follows the value for the number of hours.
  • M is the minute designator that follows the value for the number of minutes.
  • S is the second designator that follows the value for the number of seconds.

Example:
  • P1M, one month duration
  • PT1M, one minute
  • P3Y6M4DT12H30M5S, represents a duration of three years, six months,
    four days, twelve hours, thirty minutes, and five seconds

properties.title: Time date in ISO-8601
properties.description:
Define the timer with a ISO-8601 date definition.

ISO 8601 Formatting Symbols
The following list explains the formatting symbols that are used to notate the ISO 8601 dates, time, datetime, durations, and interval values:
  • n, specifies a number that represents the number of years, months, or days
  • P, indicates that the duration that follows is specified by the number of years, months, days, hours, minutes, and seconds
  • T, indicates that a time value follows. Any value with a time must begin with T.
    Requirement Time values that are read by the extended notation informats that begin with the characters E8601 must use an uppercase T.
  • W, indicates that the duration is specified in weeks.
  • Z, indicates that the time value is the time in Greenwich, England, or UTC time.
  • +|-, the + indicates the time zone offset to the east of Greenwich, England. The - indicates the time zone offset to the west of Greenwich, England.
  • yyyy, specifies a four-digit year
  • mm, as part of a date, specifies a two-digit month, 01–12
  • dd, specifies a two-digit day, 01–1
  • hh, specifies a two-digit hour, 00–24
  • mm, as part of a time, specifies a two-digit minute, 00–59
  • ss, specifies a two-digit second, 00–59
  • fff | ffffff
    specifies an optional fraction of a second using the digits 0–9:
    fff use 1 - 3 digits for values read by the $N8601B informat and the $N8601E informat
    ffffff use 1 - 6 digits for informat other than the $N8601B informat and the $N8601E informat
  • Y, indicates that a year value precedes this character in a duration
  • M, as part of a date, indicates that a month value precedes this character in a duration
  • D, indicates that a day value precedes this character in a duration
  • H, indicates that an hour value precedes this character in a duration
  • M, as part of a time, indicates that a minute value precedes this character in a duration
  • S, indicates that a seconds value precedes this character in a duration

Example
  • Year: YYYY (eg 1997)
  • Year and month: YYYY-MM (eg 1997-07)
  • Complete date: YYYY-MM-DD (eg 1997-07-16)
  • Complete date plus hours and minutes: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20+01:00)
  • Complete date plus hours, minutes and seconds: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:30+01:00)
  • Complete date plus hours, minutes, seconds and a decimal fraction of a second YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:30.45+01:00)

where:
  • YYYY = four-digit year
  • MM = two-digit month (01=January, etc.)
  • DD = two-digit day of month (01 through 31)
  • hh = two digits of hour (00 through 23) (am/pm NOT allowed)
  • mm = two digits of minute (00 through 59)
  • ss = two digits of second (00 through 59)
  • s = one or more digits representing a decimal fraction of a second
  • TZD = time zone designator (Z or +hh:mm or -hh:mm)

stencils.title: Exclusive (XOR) gateway
stencils.description: When splitting, it routes the sequence flow to exactly one of the outgoing branches based on conditions. When merging, it awaits one incoming branch to complete before triggering the outgoing flow.
stencils.description_de: Es handelt sich um eine Fallunterscheidung. Abhängig von Verzweigungsbedingungen geht der Prozessfluss an genau einem ausgehenden Zweig weiter. Bei einer Zusammenführung wird auf eine der eingehenden Kanten gewartet, um den Prozess anschließend fortzuführen.

properties.title: Gateway-Typ
properties.description: The type of the gateway

properties.title: XOR type
properties.description: The type of the XOR gateway.

properties.title: X-Marker visible
properties.description: Defines whether the 'X' in the center of the gateway is visible.
properties.description_de: Gibt an, ob das kennzeichnende 'X' im Gateway sichtbar ist.

stencils.title: Parallel Gateway
stencils.description: When used to split the sequence flow, all outgoing branches are activated simultaneously. When merging parallel branches it waits for all incoming branches to complete before triggering the outgoing flow.
stencils.description_de: Bei einer verzweigenden Verwendung werden sämtliche nachfolgenden Zweige gleichzeitig ausgeführt. Bei der Zusammenführung wird auf alle eingehenden Kanten gewartet, bevor der Prozessfluss fortgesetzt wird.

properties.title: Gateway type
properties.description: The type of the gateway.

stencils.title: Inclusive (OR) Gateway
stencils.description: Inclusive Gateways play a role to select some from several Sequence Flows, which suit the condition (the conditional expression is true). At least one Sequence Flow must be selected
stencils.description_de: Bei einer inclusiven Verwendung werden einige der nachfolgenden Zweige ausgeführt.

properties.title: Gateway type
properties.description: The type of the gateway.

stencils.title: Event gateway
stencils.description: Upon the occurrence of the following events (timer, receive task, message), the corresponding path is executed
stencils.description_de: Bei Eintreten eines der nachfolgenden Ereignisse(Timer, Empfangstask, Message), wird der entsprechende Pfad ausgeführt

properties.title: Parallel
properties.description: Not really used, only to show the diamond

stencils.title: Start Event

stencils.description_de: Hier beginnt der normale Prozessfluss durch eine nicht näher beschriebene Auslösebedingung.

stencils.title: Sequence Flow
stencils.description: Sequence flow defines the execution order of activities.
stencils.description_de: Ein Sequenzfluss definiert die Ausführungsreihenfolge von Aktivitäten.

stencils.title: Association
stencils.description: Associates a text annotation with an element.

stencils.title: Text Annotation
stencils.description: Any object can be associated with a text annotation to provide additional documentation.
stencils.description_de: Jedes Objekt kann durch eine Text-Anmerkung kommentiert werden.
